RelatedSentence: ( AP ) - Arkansas Gov. Mike Beebe says he 's open to the idea of a special legislative session to address health insurance plans for public school employees as long as there 's a consensus among lawmakers about it .
Spokesman Matt DeCample said Monday that the governor wants to ensure enough legislators would vote on a bill before deciding to call them back to the state Capitol .

Sen. Jim Hendren says nearly 47,000 employees in public schools would face a 35 percent increase in their health rates unless lawmakers take action .
Sen. Jim Hendren says nearly 47,000 employees in public schools would face a 35 percent increase in their health rates unless lawmakers take action .
Hendren is the chairman for a task force that was established to study plans for school workers .
House Speaker Davy Carter says he 's talking with Senate leadership to see if a special session could happen .
